title: Experimental error while measuring final speed

content.question: Students measure <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> using a motion detector and compare the measured <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> to the expected theoretical value. What could contribute to the experimental value of <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> being greater than the theoretical value?

choices.label: Greater-than-expected friction between the block and the surface
Deformation of the block as a result of the projectileâ€™s impact
Friction between the projectile and the block as the projectile becomes embedded in the block
An increase in temperature of the block as a result of the impact
A slight downward incline of the surface the block moves on

content.answer: A slight downward incline of the surface the block moves on

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
